029c4b8f-ded9-454b-9ef3-e2348cc72978.description: The Lean Six Sigma Green Belt badge earner is able to describe and apply the following LSS concepts: Continuous process improvement (CPI), Lean concepts and its applications (5S, waste reduction, value stream mapping, error proofing), DMAIC framework, basic statistical analysis methods, tools, and control charts. Explain the integration of both Lean and Six Sigma for achieving data-driven process improvement results, team dynamics and leadership to provide effectively successful projects.
029c4b8f-ded9-454b-9ef3-e2348cc72978.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Lean Six Sigma Green Belt online training.
Complete take-home examination (takes 30-40 hours to complete) and has received a passing grade of 70% or higher
The badge earner is Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certified

757e6d2d-5290-44ab-9ba7-4a14d913da09.description: The badge earner has demonstrated the ability through hands-on exercises to perform the following: Software installation and discuss language basics, explain variables and data structures (strings, lists, matrices, dictionaries), apply flow control and function definition, perform data plotting and visualization, use modules in Python and apply object-oriented programming
757e6d2d-5290-44ab-9ba7-4a14d913da09.name: Introduction to Python Programming

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Python Programming course.
Score a passing grade on the Introduction to Python Programming final assignment

4f66903e-74d4-4294-9304-6943bafa7621.description: The badge earner is able to describe Continuous Process Improvement (CPI) with emphasis on LSS concepts and methods. They can demonstrate awareness of Lean concepts, tools and their applications, such as 5S, waste reduction, value stream mapping and error proofing. The earner can describe the DMAIC framework, identifies how to integrate Lean and Six Sigma for achieving process improvement and the team dynamics and leadership needed to deliver successful CPI projects
4f66903e-74d4-4294-9304-6943bafa7621.name: Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Lean Six SigmaYellow Belt online training
Score a passing grade on the Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt exam

5acc76b7-53e3-49af-a50e-4fdbd89e0c4d.description: The badge earner is able to define and identify the following concepts and principles that underlie Lean and Six sigma improvement methods: The history of Lean Six Sigma, distinguishing between Lean and Six Sigma, list the benefits of using Lean Six Sigma, define the roles involved in Lean Six Sigma, explain the Lean Six Sigma DMAIC framework, and recognize the 8 Wastes of processes.
5acc76b7-53e3-49af-a50e-4fdbd89e0c4d.name: Lean Six Sigma White Belt

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Lean Six Sigma White Belt online training
Score a passing grade on the Lean Six Sigma White Belt exam

8d7de8e0-75d0-48d5-99f8-313cefa5a4b2.description: The badge earner can recognize the technical and socio-cultural dimensions of project management. The earner can define a project scope and deliverables, work breakdown structure, scheduling and progress monitoring methods. The earner can describe how to allocate resources, maintain budget control and status reporting and the importance of shaping a project culture, motivating the personnel, resolving conflict and shaping customer expectations.
8d7de8e0-75d0-48d5-99f8-313cefa5a4b2.name: Project Management Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Project Management Essentials course
Score a passing grade on the Project Management Essentials final exam

285605fe-1564-4a8f-9368-ca113043cae6.description: The badge earner is able to describe the roles/responsibilities of a certified LSS Green Belt in a healthcare organization, list the fundamentals of the DMAIC methodology, use basic LSS tools for project definition and process baseline, improvement analysis, implementation and sustainability, define the need for advanced problem solving and improvement methodologies used by project teams and integrate LSS knowledge and tools to successfully implement, deploy, and sustain process improvements.
285605fe-1564-4a8f-9368-ca113043cae6.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Healthcare

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Lean Six Sigma Green Belt for Healthcare Systems course
Score a passing grade on the Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Healthcare exam
This course is recognized for 3.3 CEUs from the Thomas J. Watson School of Engineering and Applied Science at Binghamton University.

77a1be05-9113-4370-a08f-2af6f48d8ed3.description: The badge earner has been introduced to foundational Machine Learning (ML) concepts and algorithms and can identify and map problems to different classes of ML algorithms. The earner can recognize ML algorithms such as decision trees, Naïve Bayes, and logistic regression, identify subtleties and application scenarios for different supervised classification algorithms listed above and can apply ML concepts such as regularization, over-fitting, and Laplace smoothing to design efficient ML models.
77a1be05-9113-4370-a08f-2af6f48d8ed3.name: Introduction to Machine Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Machine Learning course
Pass the Introduction to Machine Learning Final Exam

2e0e7f20-6a77-45e7-854a-6538eb0bbd50.description: This crash course prepares undergraduate and graduate students looking to gain Excel skills for use in data analytics such as: data manipulation, data visualization, how to use Macros and more through this micro-credential.
2e0e7f20-6a77-45e7-854a-6538eb0bbd50.name: Excel Skills for Data Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Post-test completion highlighting submission of exercises in session that will be evaluated by the instructor.

Skill-building lab exercises using a data set to develop the following skills: Basic Setup and Usage of Excel, Data Manipulation, Formatting, and Analysis, Data Visualization, Macros and Formula Types, VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables and Visual Basic Applications (VBA).  They will also learn about how income data demonstrates disparities among gender and racial groups within the United States.

99c65b47-47e4-46e3-8346-cb21642d363d.description: The badge earner who has completed the Growing Emotional Intelligence (EI) Through Constructive Communications course has developed a deeper awareness of EI, and has been trained in how to transform communication, both verbally and non-verbally by applying two foundational dimensions of communication that affect EI. The earner has been trained in how these dimensions can guide personal actions which can shape an organizaton's culture and directly affect business performance.
99c65b47-47e4-46e3-8346-cb21642d363d.name: Emotional Intelligence

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Growing Emotional Intelligence (EI) Through Constructive Communications, a 6 hour  course.
Score a passing grade on the Growig Emotional Intelligence (EI) Through Constructive Communications course assessment
6.0 Social Work Continuing Education Contact Hours

48e2ea53-96c7-474a-b899-7273be5ed861.description: The badge earner is able to: Describe the foundational principles of design thinking to improve the patient experience, explain creative and critical thinking processes to healthcare practices, apply creative and critical thinking techniques to benefit all key stakeholders in the healthcare system, discuss the design-thinking framework for collaborative problem-solving as it applies to healthcare and apply key design-thinking practices to improve patient or persona experiences.
48e2ea53-96c7-474a-b899-7273be5ed861.name: Design Thinking for Healthcare

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Design Thinking Healthcare one-day workshop
Score a passing grade on the Design Thinking Healthcare course assessment or successful application of a Design Thinking project; as approved by instructor.

40c5e6c4-1ffe-4d60-b09e-2280c335a78e.description: The earner of this badge has developed the ability to understand GD&T definitions, terminology and basic rules and can explain the general dimensioning concepts. The earner is able to describe the symbology and datums used in GD&T drawings and discuss the effects of various application options on GD&T. Further, the earner can calculate critical values using GD&T, read a GD&T drawing and begin applying it to actual designs.
40c5e6c4-1ffe-4d60-b09e-2280c335a78e.name: Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing

alignments.name: Professional Engineering
alignments.description: 6 Professional Development Hours (PDH) for Professional Engineers. This course complies with the requirements of the NYS Office of Professions for continuing professional education.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the GD&T 6-hour course that closely follows the ASME Y14.5-2009 standard.
Score a passing grade on the GD&T course assessment

17ca51c1-8043-4df0-9194-6353c73d7e5d.description: This professional development equips participants with essential knowledge and skills to conduct Point of Care (POC) testing for SARS-CoV-2. This training consists of: (a) Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) for confidentiality of protected health information, (b) personal protective equipment (including donning and doffing), (c) obtaining nasal swab specimens, (d) sample management for processing specimens, and (e) analyzer operation for for obtaining specimen results.
17ca51c1-8043-4df0-9194-6353c73d7e5d.name: Antigen Testing for SARS-CoV-2

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of required training modules (posttest completion - minimum score 80%).
Participation in training sessions (monitored using QR codes).
Participation in SARS-CoV-2 testing event (sign-in).

c090061f-8f23-4b24-a22d-9e875029a160.description: The badge earner is able to define the following topics: Quality History and Juran's Quality Principles, Cost of Quality and the Cost of Poor Quality, the 7 "Old" and 7 "New" Total Quality Management (TQM Tools), Metrology and Measurement System Analysis (MSA), Process Capability and Process Stability, Process Capability and Process Stability, Achieving 6-Sigma Quality Performance and beyond, Multivariate and Short Run SPC, Quality Management Systems following ISO and Malcolm Baldrige criteria
c090061f-8f23-4b24-a22d-9e875029a160.name: Quality Management Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Quality Management Fundamentals course
Pass the Quality Management Fundamentals Final Exam

skills.name: Total Quality Management Principles And Techniques

8909260b-131b-4ac8-88cf-d2c0325537d5.description: The badge earner has been introduced to several important programming concepts such as variables, if-else, loops, strings and recursions and is able to; write and execute Java programs, define and declare variables, write if-else statements, define and manipulate arrays, write for and while loops, manipulate strings and write recursive code.
8909260b-131b-4ac8-88cf-d2c0325537d5.name: Introduction to Java

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Java Programming course
Pass the Introduction to Java Final Assignment

a9d4ed53-bfd3-4223-b063-4f056e8b1474.description: The badge earner is able to describe the probability concepts; mean, variance, conditional probability, Bayes rule and statistical independence and compute the mean and variance of random variables. The earner is able to describe discrete and continuous distributions such as geometric, binomial, Poisson, uniform, exponential and normal and can compute the derive properties of functions of random variables and understand how real-world phenomena can be modeled using probability distributions.
a9d4ed53-bfd3-4223-b063-4f056e8b1474.name: Probability for Data Science

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Probability for Data Science course
Earn a passing grade on the Probability for Data Science final exam

217a4793-063d-46f2-b614-88d1a39e4b24.description: The badge earner is able to design and analyze fundamental algorithms and is able to explain and describe key algorithmic concepts and principles including the following: Sorting Algorithms (selection sort, bubble sort, insertion sort), Time and Space Complexity Analysis (big-oh, omega and theta notations), Recursive Algorithms and Master Theorem, Divide and Conquer Algorithms (merge sort, quick sort and matrix multiplication), Trees (binary search trees, AVL trees, red-black trees).
217a4793-063d-46f2-b614-88d1a39e4b24.name: Introduction to Algorithms

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Algorithms online course
Obtain passing grade on the Introduction to Algorithms final exam

d64d374a-2d12-4ab9-85e6-a7469f35cec8.description: Python is one of the most versatile programming languages and is used in web design, data analysis, and artificial intelligence. Python is also easy to learn. This credential helps beginners familiarize themselves with the basics of Python including using basic control flow, data types, simple data structures, and functions. Developing code using the IDLE environment, writing simple graphical programs, and working with files and network programming, including making API calls.
d64d374a-2d12-4ab9-85e6-a7469f35cec8.name: Programming with Python

badge_template_activities.title: Students each submit a short program that graphically plots a the 3n+1 sequence mathematical formula for assessment.

ffcdd7be-3333-48ac-9539-82e16d6cc677.description: This badge will provide the opportunity for Watson College students, alumni, and professionals to develop fundamental skills that will enhance their career development and increase their employability. Resources and individual guidance with an expert will be provided for course participants. Upon completion of the micro-credential, course participants will possess four learning artifacts, including a professional resume and cover letter, complete LinkedIn profile, and a critiqued mock interview.
ffcdd7be-3333-48ac-9539-82e16d6cc677.name: Watson Career Development Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Engineering or computer science-specific professional resume
Cover letter tailored to a position of interest in alignment with the individual’s career goals
LinkedIn profile complete with a professional headshot, headline, summary, experience and education sections, skills, and plan for developing connections
Mock interview practice and personalized feedback for improvement

af3dfbdd-0bcb-449c-b999-d435a484bc2c.description: The badge earner can apply foundational concepts of data analytics that is the fundamentals of probability and statistics. The earner can describe and apply concepts of basic descriptive statistics, inferential statistics and applied statistics.
af3dfbdd-0bcb-449c-b999-d435a484bc2c.name: Introduction to Probability & Statistics

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Probability and Statistics online training.
Score a passing grade on the Introduction to Probability and Statistics course assessment

skills.name: Probability And Statistics With Small Data

4a252ed9-abbe-4c94-b5ea-5b470dea9082.description: The badge earner can recognize sound systems engineering & analysis methods and describe how these methods help them better relate to the systems around us, and more importantly, helps to design or redesign these systems, processes and practices that allows them to operate more efficiently and effectively from an end-user perspective. The badge earner can identify important Systems Engineering concepts from system design and deployment to field performance and reliability.
4a252ed9-abbe-4c94-b5ea-5b470dea9082.name: Introduction to Systems Engineering & Systems Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Systems Engineering & Systems Analysis course
Earn a passing grade on the Introduction to Systems Engineering & Systems Analysis final exam

de92c46f-f022-4749-8542-3fb722da41c9.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Engineering Ethics training at Binghamton University and is better prepared to lead and ethical engineering organization and has acquired the ability to deal with the moral complexity in Engineering. The badge earner is trained in the following areas: moral awareness, cogent moral reasoning, moral coherence, moral imagination, moral communication, moral reasonableness, respect for persons, tolerance of diversity, moral hope and integrity.
de92c46f-f022-4749-8542-3fb722da41c9.name: Engineering Ethics

alignments.name: Professional Engineering
alignments.description: 6 Professional Development Hours (PDH) for Professional Engineers. This course complies with the requirements of the NYS Office of the Professions for continuing professional education for engineers

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Engineering Ethics 6 hour course.
Score a passing grade on the Engineering Ethics course assessment

191c4fce-0636-4c34-9644-c5d5356ade19.description: The badge earner can describe point estimation techniques, apply ML algorithms to perceptrons, neural network models, support vector machines, and k-nearest neighbors and can also identify subtleties and application scenarios for the algorithms listed and can apply regularization, over-fitting, maximum likelihood estimation, gradient descent, back-propagation, Lagrange for solving constrained optimization problems, bias-variance tradeoff, and curse of dimensionality to design efficient ML models
191c4fce-0636-4c34-9644-c5d5356ade19.name: Advanced Machine Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Advanced Machine Learning course
Pass the Advanced Algorithms Final Exam

39a82892-0f38-4cc4-842d-93401b30ecc7.description: This microcredential offers students opportunities to apply their fundamental Python skills to hands-on individual and group projects. Projects and labs include web development, game development, calling APIs, web scraping, and building applications. Students learned command line, html/css, and markup/markdown languages, and an introduction to project management.
39a82892-0f38-4cc4-842d-93401b30ecc7.name: Coding in Action

badge_template_activities.title: Students will complete HARP 150 & 151 with a C+ or higher.

Students have the choice to develop an application, access multiple datasets and create visualizations and an analysis of the data, or develop a game. Students follow a project management cycle, including user research prior to development of their project and user testing after their prototype is created.

347f5236-4b62-473c-a049-20c02c0e4bf9.description: This crash course will prepare participants looking to gain essential skills of data analytics such as gathering, cleaning, spatializing, and visualizing data. This course will engage participants in Tableau, an analytics program used in private businesses, public institutions, and NGOs for data analysis and visualization. This course is intended for newcomers to data analysis and visualization with no prior experience using Tableau.
347f5236-4b62-473c-a049-20c02c0e4bf9.name: Tableau for Data Analysis & Visualization

badge_template_activities.title: Students will engage in an array challenges led by instructor applying the skills of data manipulation, data visualization, during the 5 hour session demonstrating competency.

23e83743-95d7-4e4f-b9a8-401f03c5f50c.description: The International Tutor Training Program Certification (ITTPC) is an accredited certification by the College Reading and Learning Association (CRLA) since 1989. This certification provides recognition and positive reinforcement for tutors while also upholding exemplary standards for the training and skills they receive. Tutors with this certification demonstrate understanding of the basics of holding a tutoring session.
23e83743-95d7-4e4f-b9a8-401f03c5f50c.name: International Tutor Training Program Certification (ITTPC) Level 1 - Certified Tutor

badge_template_activities.title: Tutors undergo regular evaluations (once a semester) to solidify that they are meeting CRLA standards and employing effective tutoring methods outlined in ITTPC training.

Tutors are required to hold at least 25 logged hours of tutoring to receive certification. These hours are tracked through online scheduling software and confirmed by the Director of University Tutorial Services.
Tutors are required to attend 8 hours of in-person training and 4 hours of online training on the basics of tutoring. 12 hours total of training must be completed before certification is awarded.

5e3fddcd-242f-4ff1-90b4-b45b2f924a49.description: The badge earner is able to identify the advantages/disadvantages of layering to TCP/IP networking and can define essential networking applications. The earner can recognize the functionality and inter-layer relationships of TCP/IP protocol suite including TCP, UDP, IP, ARP, routing protocols and media access protocols. They can recognize the theory and practical aspects related to wireless networks and can define simple analytical models to estimate network performance.
5e3fddcd-242f-4ff1-90b4-b45b2f924a49.name: Introduction to Computer Networks

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Introduction to Computer Networks Course
Receive a passing grade on the final exam for the Introduction to Computer Networks course

fc50ccfa-57f5-4afe-9e2c-1625a914d5dc.description: The badge earner can; define leadership and management, explain how these roles can be integrated and describe the concept of long-term strategic planning. The earner can describe why core competencies and valuing change is necessary, how to successfully implement change, recognize the fear and stress associated with change, define a set of personal and professional ethics, morals, values and beliefs and can describe factors important in creating sustainable competitive advantage.
fc50ccfa-57f5-4afe-9e2c-1625a914d5dc.name: Leadership Essentials for Engineers

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has completed the Leadership Essentials 6 hour Workshop
The badge earner has passed the Leadership Essentials exam with a grade of 80% or higher.

0051be8c-a3a8-4b07-bc3d-19da9999288e.description: At the completion of the LEAD program, students will be able to identify best practices to strengthen civic and community engagement work, apply concepts to their current and future community and civic experiences, and connect community and civic involvement to professional and personal development. Through regular community service, biweekly seminars, and individual and group reflection, students will be better prepared to advance civic change and serve as valuable members of their community.
0051be8c-a3a8-4b07-bc3d-19da9999288e.name: Leaders in Engagement Advocacy and Democracy (LEAD)

badge_template_activities.title: Students will complete weekly community service activities.
Students will participate in biweekly seminars.
Students will make a final presentation on their learning.

f35c9230-ab1f-4058-921d-910e59c7ae3e.description: The badge earner is able to use powerful design thinking tools and techniques to develop real solutions to difficult problems across industries. The badge earner is able to: Identify key personas, create empathy maps, apply ideation techniques, use prioritization grids to support team decisions and reaching consensus, and create a storyboard to pitch new design concepts and breakthrough solutions.
f35c9230-ab1f-4058-921d-910e59c7ae3e.name: Design Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Design Thinking course, a 6 hour one-day Workshop
Score a passing grade on the Design Thinking course assessment

9ad2ee6b-9df2-4ae0-be3b-0c2f1d95e53e.description: The badge earner has gained working knowledge of the most common Data Analysis tools in Excel such as: Creating Tables (& Pivot Tables) Performing V-lookup Function, Constructing A Simple Pie Chart, Plotting Line Charts, Creating Column And Bar Charts, Performing Basic Arithmetic Operations, Performing Pareto Analysis, Performing Correlation & Regression Analysis, Plotting Histograms, Creating Box Plots, Constructing Trend Lines And Forecasting and many other graphical techniques.
9ad2ee6b-9df2-4ae0-be3b-0c2f1d95e53e.name: Data Analytics using Excel

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Data Analytics using Excel one-day workshop
Score a passing grade on the Data Analytics using Excel course assignment.

75234927-8778-40eb-a22b-5dfc420783f5.description: The badge earner has applied the following analytical tools and concepts: Type 1 error, Type 2 error, ANOVA, MANOVA, Nonparametric Tests, Correlation Analysis, Regression Analysis, Multiple Regression, Logistic Regression Analysis, Root Cause Analysis, Factorial Experiment, Fractional Factorial Experiment, Minitab, Reliability Total Productive Maintenance, MANOVA with Minitab, Regression with Minitab, Correlation with Minitab.
75234927-8778-40eb-a22b-5dfc420783f5.name: Advanced Probability & Statistics

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Advanced Probability and Statistics online training.
Attain a passing grade on the Advanced Probability and Statistics course assessment

84677df3-ce81-4f58-b6a4-43375fb78589.description: The Lean Six Sigma Black Belt badge earner has demonstrated knowledge in the following areas: DMAIC applications (Define, Measure Analyze, Improve and Control), Failure Mode Effects Analysis, Advanced Lean, Advanced DOE, SPC for non-normal distributions, Optimization, Scheduling & Sequencing, Effective and Efficient teamwork strategies as well as a variety of other tools and analysis methodologies. The earner has also successfully completed a Black Belt Project in industry or non-profit agency.
84677df3-ce81-4f58-b6a4-43375fb78589.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Lean Six Sigma Black Belt online training and complete the Black Belt Project
Score a passing grade on the Lean Six Sigma Black Belt exam
Complete a Black Belt Project for industry or non-profit agency and receive a satisfactory review by the Binghamton University Lean Six Sigma teaching staff and the Project Sponsor

f4b60829-90aa-4abc-81f2-74889e755abe.description: This micro-credential recognizes the successful completion of the Binghamton DHRI, awarded to the participants who attend all of the sessions held during the week-long hands-on training and submit all of the assigned mini-projects at the end of each session.
f4b60829-90aa-4abc-81f2-74889e755abe.name: Binghamton Digital Humanities Research Institute (DHRI)

badge_template_activities.title: Daily assessments that demonstrate an understanding of digital humanities methods and applications, data-inflected thinking, computational processes, web-based communication, and the impact of algorithmic-based decisions, particularly on marginalized communities.

8c919a98-fade-4c28-9eaf-0707a8872685.description: The badge earner has successfully completed the Data Science Essentials Suite that is designed for those who would like to learn basic, in-demand skills required for an entry-level data scientist. The learner has applied fundamental python programming, the most popular and adaptable programming language in the industry today, and has demonstrated an understanding of fundamental concepts in probability for data science, machine learning, and algorithms.
8c919a98-fade-4c28-9eaf-0707a8872685.name: Data Science Essentials Suite

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the following courses: Introduction to Python Programming, Probability for Data Science, Introduction to Algorithms, and Introduction to Machine Learning.
Pass each course exam or coding assignment with a passing grade.

43f70c39-eca7-4c9f-8d77-546ea4c91250.description: The badge earner can identify complex algorithmic paradigms including greedy algorithms and dynamic programming. The earner can identify graphs using adjacency matrices and edge lists, find shortest path between vertices using Dijkstra’s algorithm, find the minimum spanning tree in a graph using Prim’s algorithm and Kruskal’s algorithm, explain and describe maximum matching in bipartite graphs and find the minimum vertex cover. The earner can explain the concept of NP and NP-completeness.
43f70c39-eca7-4c9f-8d77-546ea4c91250.name: Advanced Algorithms

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Advanced Algorithm online course
Pass the Advanced Algorithms final exam

8c2e0373-4a54-4d28-b53b-a3ce1ef9ebe5.description: The badge earner can discuss and elaborate on how we can maintain a livable environment for all on our planet, one that encourages economic growth and environmental preservation while also meeting food, water and energy needs. The earner can elaborate on the following topics; Making the case for sustainability, climate change & decision making under uncertainty, water and sustainable development, and sustainability and energy.
8c2e0373-4a54-4d28-b53b-a3ce1ef9ebe5.name: Introduction to Sustainable Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Sustainability online course
Score a passing grade on the Sustainability final exam

7d812f0b-60a0-48e0-aa51-445f9f6e5d51.description: The badge earner has successfully completed the OHSA 10 hour General Industry training at Binghamton University. The badge earner has awareness of common job-related safety and health hazards. The earner is more knowledgeable about workplace hazards and their rights, and can contribute to a safe and responsible work environment.
7d812f0b-60a0-48e0-aa51-445f9f6e5d51.name: OSHA-10 Hour General Industry

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 10 hour general industry training.
Score a passing grade on the OSHA 10 course assessment
An OSHA 10 Hour card is presented to those who successfully complete the general industry 10-hour course.

d242126f-aac6-4c9b-ac88-afdb63fd66d7.description: The badge earner is able to digitally create 2D drawings and 3D models of real-world products using the Creo Parametric 7.0 software. The badge earner is able to; create 3D parts using various features such as extrude, revolve, and patterns, assemble parts by applying different types of connections and constraints and create engineering drawings.
d242126f-aac6-4c9b-ac88-afdb63fd66d7.name: Introduction to Computer Aided Design (CAD)

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has successfully completed the Introduction to Computer Aided Design course
The badge earner has completed weekly graded assignments and passed the Final Exam with a grade of 70% or higher.

2e90066a-d8ca-4437-adca-3d85db2b7404.description: The badge earner is able to use Fusion 360 software to digitally create 3D designs using both parametric and freeform modeling tools and techniques. The badge earner is able to assemble parts by applying different joints and constraints including motion links, create 2D technical drawings from 3D designs and generate an STL fil for 3D printing.
2e90066a-d8ca-4437-adca-3d85db2b7404.name: Computer-Aided Design with Fusion 360

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has successfully completed the Computer-Aided Design with Fusion 360 course
The badge earner has completed online course content, attended four in-person workshops, completed an assigned project, and passed the final exam with a grade of 75% or higher.

16f50ca9-87ee-4715-8642-99c0d9dabe4d.description: No experience is required to join this crash course in communications planning, brand building and search engine optimization. Participants will learn and apply the essential concepts and methods behind successful digital communications, including how to: Create and manage a social media presence for an organization, Utilize FB/IG ads, Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and more
16f50ca9-87ee-4715-8642-99c0d9dabe4d.name: Communications Planning and Search Engine Optimization

badge_template_activities.title: Students will engage in team communications plan development applying the media and SEO skills, during the 5 hour session demonstrating competency.

e9c51912-2bc7-40b5-aed1-4b068a1463af.description: The badge earner is able to: Define Design of Experiments (DOE) and its benefits, Describe an input variable (factor), settings (levels) and output variables (response) in a design of experiments, Explain the difference between full and fractional factorial designs, Describe key concepts of randomization, aliasing, blocking and replications, Analyze the outputs of a DOE using an analysis of variance (ANOVA) table and Describe the steps in performing an effective DOE
e9c51912-2bc7-40b5-aed1-4b068a1463af.name: Design of Experiments (DOE)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Design of Experiments (DOE) online course
Complete the Design of Experiments (DOE) final exam with a grade of 70% or higher

a8fb16bb-d998-47d4-9022-10ec25457392.description: The badge earner has demonstrated knowledge and application of the following Lean concepts: Strategic Planning, Kanban Simulation, Lot Size Reductions, Volume/Variety Matrix, Variability Reduction, Heijunka scheduling, Product Structure Assessment and Lean Design. The earner has completed team and individual exercises, role play simulations and group discussions to understand and apply Lean concepts.
a8fb16bb-d998-47d4-9022-10ec25457392.name: Lean Operations

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Lean Operations final exam with a grade of 70% or higher
Complete the one-day Lean Operations workshop

648c04cc-84cb-42ef-8474-debbfe6d12f3.description: The badge earner can apply key functional areas of project management: Project life-cycle, project body of knowledge (PMBOK), project constraints & project triple constraint triangle, project versus operations, project succeed and fail, planning stage, working stage and closing stage. The earner can develop an effective project definition and statement of work (SOW) and perform project planning using work breakdown structures (WBS) and Scheduling/estimating techniques (Critical Path and PERT)
648c04cc-84cb-42ef-8474-debbfe6d12f3.name: Project Management Fundamentals

alignments.name: Professional Engineering
alignments.description: 6 Professional Development Hours (PDH) for Professional Engineers. This course complies with the requirements of the NYS Office of Professions for continuing professional education.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Project Management Fundamentals live virtual course.
Score a passing grade on the Project Management course assignment

4896aa23-efec-4035-9001-fc5a67af76c0.description: The badge earner is introduced to the historical and future perspective leading to the concept of Smart Cities in the US. The earner can recognize Smart Cities concepts like; the drivers of urban evolution from the civil war and beyond, reasons why 20th century cities were the gateway to the future, and the factors driving the 21st century rise of cities. The badge earner can also identify reasons for the changing US urban landscape and recognize examples of the Smart City concept.
4896aa23-efec-4035-9001-fc5a67af76c0.name: Smart Cities

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Smart Cities course
Earn a passing grade on the Smart Cities exam

8e78c709-e865-4450-935d-bd13f407cfc0.description: The badge earner is able to understand every step in implementing ANSYS APDL for engineering analysis, demonstrate capability to model and analyze engineering problems using ANSYS APDL and extract, interpret and present results professionally. The badge earner can also demonstrate the following skills: Element type selection, material definition, modeling and meshing, boundary condition and load definition, analysis type and solution and post-processing.
8e78c709-e865-4450-935d-bd13f407cfc0.name: Finite Element Method (FEM) using ANSYS

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the FEM using ANSYS online training.
Score a passing grade on the FEM using ANSYS course assessment

e06f78f4-e6cb-4fc5-80ab-f3ba6410c5dd.description: This program is a high-impact learning scavenger hunt of sorts for first-year undergraduate Harpur College students. The Edge-Finder program was designed to get students engaged in Harpur College and the University as a whole while they build skills that will give them a professional, academic and personal edge. By completing the Edge-Finder program new Harpur students will gain experiences, develop leadership, communication, and technology skills all while defining their own unique Harpur Edge.
e06f78f4-e6cb-4fc5-80ab-f3ba6410c5dd.name: Harpur Edge-Finder

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a Harpur History informational session and write a reflection on what it means to be a Harpur College student and the overall experience of completing the Edge-Finder program

Get Involved with Student Organizations by attending two student organization events: one within your comfort zone and one outside of your comfort zone.  Then write a reflection on the experience, what you learned and how you can use this experience to inform future decisions.
Participate in one of a listing of Harpur Edge Programs or Services and reflect on how Harpur Edge services and programs can support you throughout your time at Binghamton.

Cultivate Holistic Wellness and Awareness by participating in at least one of the programs in campus recreation, residential life, MRC, Q Center, ISSS, SSD or a faith-based organization and reflecting on the experience.  Then write a reflection on the experience, what you learned and how it will inform future decision making and coping skills.
Utilize Academic Programs and Services from a list of options and reflect on how engaging in these services can help you going forward.

Connect with Faculty by attending one event from a list of events faculty are hosting.Then write a self-reflection on what you gained from the experience, what you learned and how you can apply the knowledge going forward.

Engage in Harpur Edge Professional Development Programs by attending one or more from a list of opportunities and writing a reflection on the experience and how you can use apply your learning going forward.
Leverage Technology by completing two or more of a list of challenges.  Then write a reflection on the skills gained and how you can use them going forward.
Explore experiential learning opportunities by attending one of a listing of campus events and checking in via B-engaged.

4232bbe3-f717-4408-9da0-a96b64e97e84.description: The badge earner has completed 5 weeks of online training and is introduced to the fundamentals of FEM through typical mechanical engineering examples. The badge earner is able to understand the fundamentals of Finite Element Method and stiffness method to solve engineering problems and to write computer codes to use Finite Element Method to solve basic engineering problems. The earner is able to apply the stiffness method to solve truss, beam, frame and 1-D fluid flow problems.
4232bbe3-f717-4408-9da0-a96b64e97e84.name: Introduction to Finite Element Method (FEM)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Finite Element Method online training
Score a passing grade on the Introduction to Finite Element Method course assessment
Completed weekly graded homework assignments

8312773e-9e2f-4b53-9fd2-fb10c0f89ab9.description: The badge earner has applied and understand these analytical tools and concepts: descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, applied statistics, Type 1 error, Type 2 error, ANOVA, MANOVA, Nonparametric Tests, Correlation Analysis, Regression Analysis, Multiple Regression, Logistic Regression Analysis, Root Cause Analysis, Factorial Experiment, Fractional Factorial Experiment, Minitab, Reliability Total Productive Maintenance, MANOVA with Minitab, Regression and Correlation with Minitab.
8312773e-9e2f-4b53-9fd2-fb10c0f89ab9.name: Stacked Introductory and Advanced Probability & Statistics

badge_template_activities.title: Complete both the Introduction to Probability & Statistics course and the Advanced Probability & Statistics course.
Score a passing grade on both the Introduction to Probability & Statistics and Advanced Probability and Statistics course assessments.

1c641908-c3dc-4085-98b6-ebe2c9331133.description: The badge earner can discuss and elaborate on the industrial revolution, the introduction of fossil fuels as well as the history of energy. The earner understands the recent world energy production and consumption by energy source and the role of the sun and geothermal energy in formation of coal, oil and natural gas. The earner can discuss aspects of nuclear energy (both fission and fusion) and the role of renewable energy, the socio-political issues of energy and energy forecasting.
1c641908-c3dc-4085-98b6-ebe2c9331133.name: Universe of Energy

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has completed the Universe of Energy online course.
Score a passing grade on the Universe of Energy course assessment

2c5bcabc-bc51-485b-823a-1124413545c5.description: The badge earner has completed the Intro to FEM and the FEM using ANSYS training and is able to implement ANSYS APDL for engineering analysis, demonstrate capability to model and analyze engineering problems using ANSYS APDL and extract, interpret and present results professionally and can also demonstrate the following skills: Element type selection, material definition, modeling and meshing, boundary condition and load definition, analysis type and solution and post-processing.
2c5bcabc-bc51-485b-823a-1124413545c5.name: Finite Element Method (FEM) using ANSYS

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Intro to FEM and FEM using ANSYS online training
Score a passing grade on both the Intro to FEM and FEM using ANSYS course assessments
Complete weekly graded homework assignments

d26e289c-8712-402d-b090-1ab46690ccc2.description: The badge earner has successfully completed the Data Science Advanced Suite that is designed for those who would like to learn more advanced, in-demand skills required for a data scientist. The learner has applied fundamental Java programming skills, and has demonstrated an understanding of advanced concepts in machine learning, and algorithms.
d26e289c-8712-402d-b090-1ab46690ccc2.name: Data Science Advanced Suite

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the following courses: Introduction to Java Programming, Advanced Algorithms, and Advanced Machine Learning

1baf6480-7cbd-4edc-b78f-51cd1a93a75f.description: The badge earner has successfully completed the three courses in the Engineering Management Suite. The learner is able to recognize in-demand skills required in a leadership role, identify moral complexity, and can identify tools critical to business and organizational result-oriented management style. The badge earner can recognize ways to inspire and motivate people and teams to succeed and perform at a higher level.
1baf6480-7cbd-4edc-b78f-51cd1a93a75f.name: Engineering Management Suite

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Leadership, Engineering Ethics, and Project Management Essentials courses and pass each individual course exam with a grade of 70% or higher.

06c3b15a-cbce-4ae4-a1a7-a24de3ce3283.description: The badge earner has demonstrated the ability to use basic Linux commands such as cd, ls, mkdir, and more advanced commands such as find, grep (including regular expressions), and du. The earner can apply such commands to file management and navigation and is able to combine these commands into scripts for automation and streamlining. The earner can effectively use Linux command line and shell scripts to streamline and automate workflows.
06c3b15a-cbce-4ae4-a1a7-a24de3ce3283.name: Linux Command Line Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Linux Command Line Fundamentals course

519b7968-903e-4580-863e-cf8b8a89977d.description: The badge earner has successfully completed the three courses in the Quality Management Suite. The badge earner can identify tools and techniques required to measure a company's ability to consistently, effectively, and efficiently meet customer needs. The badge earner can collect and analyze a variety of data types using descriptive and inferential statistics and interpret data sets, as well as understand the appropriate analytical techniques for various types of data collected.
519b7968-903e-4580-863e-cf8b8a89977d.name: Quality Management Suite

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Probability & Statistics, Advanced Probability & Statistics, and Quality Management Essentials courses and pass each individual course exam with a grade of 70% or higher.

095d4d2f-832d-432f-bb66-e5ce40e8bbf0.description: The Sustainable Engineering Design badge earner can explain the process of Concurrent Engineering, describe the Voice of Customer (VOC) and use the Kano Model to prioritize end user needs, determine Product Specifications for improved sustainability, discuss Manufacturing Strategies for sustainability, describe the Product Life Cycle and it's importance for sustainable design, and explain the various dimensions of Design For X's (DFX’s) and their importance for sustainable design.
095d4d2f-832d-432f-bb66-e5ce40e8bbf0.name: Sustainable Engineering Design

alignments.name: Professional Engineering
alignments.description: 6 Professional Development Hours (PDH) for Professional Engineers. This course complies with the requirements of the NYS Office of Professions for continuing professional education.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 6 hour Sustainable Engineering Design course
Score a passing grade on the Sustainable Engineering Design instructor graded exam with a grade of 70% or higher

skills.name: Understanding The Voice Of The Customer

b4807f8a-8ed9-401f-bbda-a0cd7b5fae29.description: The badge earner is able to describe the roles/responsibilities of a certified LSS Yellow Belt in a healthcare organization, list the fundamentals of the DMAIC methodology, use basic LSS tools for project definition and process baseline, improvement analysis, implementation and sustainability, define the need for advanced problem solving and improvement methodologies used by project teams and integrate LSS knowledge and tools to successfully implement, deploy, and sustain process improvements.
b4807f8a-8ed9-401f-bbda-a0cd7b5fae29.name: Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Healthcare

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt online training

b7f32379-11c3-4ed8-89d2-d4885e501491.description: R is one of the most popular programming languages for data science. This crash course introduces undergraduate and graduate students to data analytics and visualization techniques using R. We cover simple data structures, data types, and basic functions to interpret, graph, and present data. No prior knowledge of R or statistics is required.
b7f32379-11c3-4ed8-89d2-d4885e501491.name: Coding in R

badge_template_activities.title: Participants who score 70% or better on the post-test will earn the microcredential that supports their applications to internship opportunities in a variety of private and public sector organizations.

956d6ede-1481-4dc5-9770-f9d1f6cc020e.description: Along with Python and R, SQL is one of the most widely-used and in demand languages for data science, and is also used widely in business intelligence and web development. In this program, you will learn how and why databases are used to efficiently store and access massive quantities of data, as well as how to write basic SQL to manipulate and summarize data. This course is an ideal first step into data analytics: no prior skill in programming or statistics is expected.
956d6ede-1481-4dc5-9770-f9d1f6cc020e.name: Coding in SQL

badge_template_activities.title: Students will write queries in SQL to access and summarize data, including filtering, functions, grouping, sorting, and joins between tables. In addition, students will learn to create new databases and apply basic database design to efficiently organize and structure data. Students will be assessed on their completion of both written exercises (on the SQL portion) and well a quiz (on the database theory portion).

c417452b-95e4-4bce-b35a-c1a4038da167.description: This training involves making calls for contact tracing of individuals who were in close contact with a person who has tested positive for SARS-CoV-2. This self-paced training delivers educational modules and live training that cover: (a) Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), (b) Incident Command System and the National Response Framework, (c) psychological first aid, and (d) use of the NYS Communicable Disease Case Management System (CommCare).
c417452b-95e4-4bce-b35a-c1a4038da167.name: COVID-19 Close Contact Calling / Contact Tracking

badge_template_activities.title: Training Modules - Certificates of completion
Participation in local health department training.
Membership in the Medical Reserve Corps.
Satisfactory performance on quality monitoring of contact tracing.

123d4906-1d63-41f4-93e7-e39ce91160e4.description: Public speaking remains among the most feared skills to apply by most. In this session, students will be able to structure and deliver an effective speech with improved confidence and skill. They will also learn techniques that will empower them to provide feedback and improve peer’s presentation skills.
123d4906-1d63-41f4-93e7-e39ce91160e4.name: Effective Public Speaking

badge_template_activities.title: Identify what makes an effective speech – Students will both present a speech and give feedback to a peer using what they have learned in this session. The instructor will also provide written feedback for each participant.
Understand how power is constructed in both speech construction and the environment in which they speak.
Think strategically about how information is organized and delivered.
Apply theory of effective public speaking, which means that they will learn to convey ideas in a credible manner and demonstrate confidence, clarity of voice and word

2cd34e9a-abc9-4131-b434-71e887883c30.description: The Foundations of Civic Engagement Badge program will provide a structure for students to develop the knowledge, skills and experiences to succeed as current and future community leaders. Students will move through a series of self-paced modules and activities focused on civic participation, voting and elections, contacting elected officials and advocacy.
2cd34e9a-abc9-4131-b434-71e887883c30.name: Foundations of Civic Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: Students will review foundational content on community engagement.
Students will complete selected community actions.
Students will submit a final reflection.

1f8c1751-6c8d-48f3-995d-688051afba74.description: The Foundations of Community Engagement Badge program will provide a structure for students to develop the knowledge, skills and experiences to succeed as current and future community leaders. Students will move through a series of self-paced modules and activities and will complete 10 hours of community service.
1f8c1751-6c8d-48f3-995d-688051afba74.name: Foundations of Community Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: Students will review foundational content on community engagement.
Students will complete selected community actions.
Students will submit a final reflection.

dbc2f1a6-2946-4eb0-aea5-dff3c6982716.description: The earner of this badge can successfully deliver and instruct the 6 hour GD&T course and can enable students to understand GD&T definitions, terminology and basic rules and can explain the general dimensioning concepts. The earner can teach the symbology and datums used in GD&T drawings and discuss the effects of various application options on GD&T. The earner can teach how to calculate critical values using GD&T, read a GD&T drawing and begin applying it to actual designs.
dbc2f1a6-2946-4eb0-aea5-dff3c6982716.name: Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing Instructor

alignments.name: Professional Engineers
alignments.description: 6 Professional Development Hours (PDH) for Professional Engineers. This course complies with the requirements of the NYS Office of Professions for continuing professional education.

badge_template_activities.title: Provided a face-to-face 6 hour class where knowledge and skills were delivered via class room instruction

9fe585e4-2e24-493a-8f53-fd6553c995df.description: The badge has been exposed to use case studies, exercises, and discussion to understand and apply the human factors and ergonomics tools, principles and best practices. The badge earner will be able to understand and apply the following skills: The role of ergonomics in design and production operations, the tools to manage and plan for ergonomics, human error and how it relates to ergonomics and understand how to account for human error in design and production operations.
9fe585e4-2e24-493a-8f53-fd6553c995df.name: Human Factors & Ergonomics

alignments.name: Professional Engineering
alignments.description: 6 Professional Development Hours (PDH) for Professional Engineers. This course complies with the requirements of the NYS Office of Professions for continuing professional education.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Human Factors & Ergonomics  6-hour course
Score a passing grade on the Human Factors & Ergonomics course assessment

cab29ce7-caca-4861-8dcf-eb90116a7e52.description: The International Tutor Training Program Certification (ITTPC) is an accredited certification by the College Reading and Learning Association (CRLA) since 1989. This certification provides recognition and positive reinforcement for tutors while also upholding exemplary standards for the training and skills they receive. Tutors with this certification understand the basics processes, as well as metacognitive and psychosocial aspects of tutoring.
cab29ce7-caca-4861-8dcf-eb90116a7e52.name: International Tutor Training Program Certification (ITTPC) Level 2 – Advanced Tutor

badge_template_activities.title: Tutors undergo regular evaluations (once a semester) to solidify that they are meeting CRLA standards and employing effective tutoring methods outlined in ITTPC training.

Tutors are required to hold at least 25 logged hours of tutoring to receive certification. These hours are tracked through an online scheduling software and confirmed by the Director of University Tutorial Services.
Tutors are required to attend and complete 10 hours of in-person and online training in order to receive Level 2 certification from the CRLA.

b0e30e96-6113-4d9d-80c1-6626a71065f5.description: Participants will apply skills gained in Intro to Python Coding to design a multi-file Python graphical application. Participants will learn and apply programming concepts such as classes, modules, callback functions, and program state.
b0e30e96-6113-4d9d-80c1-6626a71065f5.name: Programming with Python Intermediate

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will apply coding skills to design a video game. Functionality of the game will determine if the participant is awarded this intermediate credential.

fd240aa2-b01b-4931-a93b-eb29819f8b82.description: The badge earner has participated in a production/distribution simulation game and can describe the supplier/customer relationship, the importance of supply chain visibility, the impact of lead time and how decisions have an impact on the supply chain as a whole. The badge earner is able to recognize supply chain best practices such as; replacing forecasts with actual demand, smoothing variability utilizing max/min ordering and disintermediation of non-value added supply chain nodes.
fd240aa2-b01b-4931-a93b-eb29819f8b82.name: Supply Chain Management

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Supply Chain Management course
Pass the instructor graded Supply Chain Management exam with a grade of 70% or higher.

skills.name: Best Practices And Configuration For Core Supply Chain Scope Items

119fc62d-7d46-4f33-a6ae-1460c660ea09.description: The Rural and Underserved Service Track (TRUST) is a collaboration between the Binghamton University School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, Department of Social Work, Decker College of Nursing and Heath Sciences, the SUNY Upstate Medical University, and the community. The main goal of this unique, competitive co-curricular track is to develop a group of health care professionals dedicated to caring for rural, underserved populations through interprofessional teamwork.
119fc62d-7d46-4f33-a6ae-1460c660ea09.name: The Rural and Underserved Service Track

badge_template_activities.title: Every student will be required to attend all eight learning workshops throughout the two year program. During each workshop, students have the opportunity to ask questions from members of the community in focus as well as healthcare providers who work with these populations. Following, a clinical skill is taught that pertains to the population (ie suicide assessments and the Veteran population), during which students are shown how to complete the skill and then asked to practice amongst peers.
Participate in eight learning workshops that each illustrate a unique underserved population through panel discussions, complex cases, and clinical skill education
Participate in at least 10 service activities on small interprofessional teams, each service activity covering a unique healthcare education topic and encouraging patient interaction when available
Assist in leading and developing one specific service activity in the second year of the program, during which the activity will be offered multiple times at different locations with various teams

Complete reflections on each service activity and learning workshop attended, commenting specifically on what new information was learned, what can be applied to practice moving forward, and what portions that were not helpful

829638d7-e9bf-4f2d-9ae1-8589f80a22ee.description: This Microcredential is restricted to students in the Online RN-BS program to enhance their working with victims of crime, especially in emergency and psychiatric settings. The Microcredential consists of two nonsequential three-credit online courses: NURS Z335 Forensic Health Essentials (spring or summer) and NURS Z335B Forensic Health of Victims (fall). This Microcredential will be limited to students in the Online RN-BS program where the courses will run in a 7-week online format.
829638d7-e9bf-4f2d-9ae1-8589f80a22ee.name: Victim-Centered Forensic Health for RNs

badge_template_activities.title: NURS Z335 Forensic Health Essentials: This course provides an overview of various forensic disciplines, violence and diversity, forensic assessment and documentation, the collection and preservation of evidence, overview of criminal aspects of forensics, introduction to death investigation, basic civil issues, and principles of collaboration and consultation.

NURS Z335B Forensic Health of Victims: This course provides an overview of victim needs and rights, responses to trauma/trauma informed approach, victim’s resources, expert witness testimony, assessment and intervention strategies for intrafamilial violence, sexual violence, stalking, workplace violence, hate crimes, homicide, and nonviolent crimes, such as DUI.

At the end of the two courses, students will also complete a portfolio showcasing the basic skills they learned in: forensic assessment, evidence collection, trauma-informed care, expert witness testimony, and assessment and intervention plan (inclusive of cultural competence and referrals) development for victims of family, sexual, and workplace violence, as well as those subjected to hate and nonviolence crimes.
